Package com.github.tommyettinger.gand

Class TwistedLineI3

java.lang.Object
com.github.tommyettinger.gand.TwistedLineI3
public class TwistedLineI3 extends Object
This generates orthogonally-connected paths of PointI3 that meander through an area; this won't ever generate paths that cross themselves.
This randomly generates a graph with only some valid edges easily connected, then solves it with Algorithms.findShortestPath(Object, Object). If an edge is "easily connected", it has a cost of 1, and if it isn't, it has a cost of 1024, which strongly discourages the pathfinder from traversing that connection (but still permits it if only one path is an option). The "twisted-ness" of the path can be decreased by setting relaxation to a value greater than 0. The relaxation only needs to be increased a little above 0 to start having an effect; most values greater than 0.5 will look the same as 1.0 (mostly optimal paths, and not very "twisty").

  • Constructor Details

    • TwistedLineI3

      public TwistedLineI3()
      You probably don't want this constructor; use TwistedLineI3(Random, PointI3[], float) instead.

    • TwistedLineI3

      public TwistedLineI3(Random random, com.github.tommyettinger.gdcrux.PointI3[] traversable)
      Builds a TwistedLineI3 and calls reinitialize(PointI3[], float) using the given traversable points. You can get a line between two points using line(PointI3, PointI3) after this.
      Parameters:
      random - any Random or subclass; if null, this will create a new FlowRandom
      traversable - an array of points that this line is permitted to travel through

    • TwistedLineI3

      public TwistedLineI3(Random random, com.github.tommyettinger.gdcrux.PointI3[] traversable, float relaxation)
      Builds a TwistedLineI3 and calls reinitialize(PointI3[], float) using the given traversable points. You can get a line between two points using line(PointI3, PointI3) after this. How "twisty" the line will be can be configured by changing relaxation.
      Parameters:
      random - any Random or subclass; if null, this will create a new FlowRandom
      traversable - an array of points that this line is permitted to travel through
      relaxation - between 0.0 and 1.0, with lower values being very "twisty" and higher values being closer to straight lines

  • Method Details

    • reinitialize

      public void reinitialize(com.github.tommyettinger.gdcrux.PointI3[] traversable, float relaxation)
      This sets up a random maze as a Int3UndirectedGraph so a path can be found, using the given array of PointI3 to represent which cells on a 3D grid can actually be traversed (and so can be used in a random path). You can call this after construction to change the paths this can find.
      Parameters:
      traversable - an array of PointI3 points that are valid vertices this can travel through
      relaxation - between 0.0 and 1.0, with lower values being very "twisty" and higher values being closer to straight lines

    • randomize

      public void randomize(float relaxation)
      This sets up a random maze as an Int3UndirectedGraph so a path can be found. You can call this after construction to change the paths this can find.
      Parameters:
      relaxation - between 0.0 and 1.0, with lower values being very "twisty" and higher values being closer to straight lines

    • line

      public Path<com.github.tommyettinger.gdcrux.PointI3> line(com.github.tommyettinger.gdcrux.PointI3 start, com.github.tommyettinger.gdcrux.PointI3 end)

    • line

      public Collection<com.github.tommyettinger.gdcrux.PointI3> line(Collection<com.github.tommyettinger.gdcrux.PointI3> path, com.github.tommyettinger.gdcrux.PointI3 start, com.github.tommyettinger.gdcrux.PointI3 end)
      Finds a twisted line from start to end and appends the points of that line into path. This does not remove any existing points from path, so you may want to Collection.clear() it first.
      Parameters:
      path - will be appended to; will not be cleared first
      start - the start point to include in the path first
      end - the end point to include in the path last
      Returns:
      path, after modifications

    • getRandom

      public Random getRandom()

    • setRandom

      public void setRandom(Random random)

    • getLastPath

      public Path<com.github.tommyettinger.gdcrux.PointI3> getLastPath()
      Gets the last path this found, which may be empty. This returns the same reference to any path this produces, and the path is cleared when a new twisted line is requested. You probably want to copy the contents of this path into another list if you want to keep its contents.
      Returns:
      the most recent path of PointI3, as a Path (essentially an ObjectDeque), this found.

    • shuffle

      protected <T> void shuffle(T[] items)
